ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Is it falsehood - gods besides Allah - that you desire?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Why do you solicit false gods instead of God?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Is it false deities that you want to serve rather than Allah?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Do you want to worship false idols as your lords besides God?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “What! You desire, through fabrication, Gods other than Allah?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Is it a falsehood -- gods other than Allah -- that you desire"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: A lie-- gods besides Allah-- do you desire?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Is it a calumny, gods apart from God, that you desire?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Is it a falsehood - gods beside Allah - that ye desire?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Would you serve false deities instead of God?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Is it a falsehood-god beside Allah - that ye desire?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Is it a lie, gods other than Allah, that you desire?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Is it a falsehood- gods other than Allah- that ye desire?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Is it a falsehood aliha (gods) other than Allah that you seek?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: It is falsehood that you desire gods other than Allah!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Is it falsified gods, instead of God, that you want?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Is it falsehood [as] gods other than Allah you desire?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [37:86] Is it a calumny (a-ifkan, as regards the two hamzas, the same applies as mentioned before) — gods other   than God — that you desire? (ifkan is an object denoting reason; ālihatan is the direct object of turīdūna, ‘you desire’; ifk denotes the worst kind of lie). In other words: do you worship [any] other than God?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: They replied: "we worship idols", to which Abraham said: (Is it a falsehood gods beside Allah that ye desire) do you then worship false deities?
